Posted By: phyrexiantrygon (1/26/2012 6:08:21 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
My favorite card of the set. Powerful and cheap to cast, but removable and requires hitting the player to be really scary, so it's not something overwhelming. Even a 1/2 stops her at first, but once she does manage to get a hit the damage increase rapidly.  
  
Here's the quick math.  
  
1st attack- 3 damage, 3/3  
2nd attack- 7 damage, 5/5  
3rd attack- 11 damage, 7/7  
Total- 21 damage  
  
+4 damage and +2/+2 each time she hits the player is not bad, considering you'd be using red (and likely black) to blast away any creatures in her path.
posts.html:

Posted By: thepillow (1/29/2012 7:39:49 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I'm a bit nervous about dropping a 1/1 on turn 3, attacking turn 4...but if you can get her to hit JUST ONCE, you've got a 3/3 who can kamikazi an X/6. Get her to hit once more and you have a 5/5. 5/5 double strike on turn 6 is NOT bad, especially when you only paid 3 mana for her. But this is all assuming you can get her through in the first place, which will not always be easy.   
  
The art is fantastic though. Coolest looking Vampire of all, she's not even "dark" or "edgy" I don't think. I like the pink and red color scheme and the subtle sort of "Queen of Hearts" look to her.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
A riddle:  
You make and stack a deck of basic lands and a single creature. Your goal is to take out a goldfish as quickly as possible. How fast can you kill your opponent?   
This and [Mayor of Avabruck](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mayor of Avabruck) can perform a satisfying kill of the goldfish in just 6 turns. What are the other creatures that can kill by turn 6? Is anything faster?
